name: NEW PRODUCT MANAGEMENT

values.comments:
This course examines the marketing aspects of products or services exclusive of their promotion, pricing, or distribution. It focuses on decisions regarding product introduction, positioning, improvements, deletion, and the tools available for making these decisions.

Students remark that this is a “great course” and that the half semester “went by too fast.” They believe it would “be beneficial to extend the course for a full semester.”

Professor Adams is “passionate,” “charismatic,” and “brings the real world right into the classroom” with his “vast experience.” There is “never a dull class” due to Professor Adams’ “amazing energy and great sense of humor.” Some criticism includes the “lack of structure” in the course and the “disorganization” of the professor.

Students comment that there is a lot of reading for the course. They also write that because most of the work “comes at the end of the course” instead of being “spread out over the six weeks,” they “couldn’t get the most out of the project.”
